alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Northern Gila County; White Mountains (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 13 at 1:38PM MST until January 15 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT SATURDAY NIGHT TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY ABOVE 5500 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 5500 feet. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches, with higher amounts up to 11 inches over the highest portion of the White Mountains. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Areas above 5500 feet near Alpine, Buffalo Pass, Ganado, Pine-Strawberry, Pinetop-Lakeside, Shonto, Show Low and Window Rock. * WHEN...From midnight Saturday night to 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...After a lull in the snow Sunday night, another storm is forecast to bring additional snow Monday into Tuesday. Please watch for later statements and possible watches or warnings. Snow forecast from midnight Sunday to 5 PM Sunday: Alpine 3 to 5 inches Buffalo Pass 4 to 6 inches Ganado 2 to 4 inches Pine-Strawberry 3 to 5 inches Pinetop-Lkside 3 to 5 inches Shonto 2 to 4 inches Show Low 2 to 4 inches Window Rock 2 to 4 inches .
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
